speaker: IZZY
line: You’re flooding it, Booger.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: For God’s sake, Izzy!

speaker: BOOGER
line: Here she comes. Let’s go. Come on, man.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: You got to be kidding.

speaker: IZZY
line: What?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Don’t "what" me, Izzy, or you ain’t going to no comic book convention.

speaker: IZZY
line: I’m 18. I go anywhere I want.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Yeah, but where you going to live when you get back?

speaker: IZZY
line: Mom, we got to get going.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: You drive careful, Booger. He’s the only son I’ve got.

speaker: BOOGER
line: Okay, Mrs. B.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: I'm about to introduce you to a woman who three years ago was delivered the surprise of her life.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: After nine months of what seemed like a normal pregnancy, doctors delivered to Dolores a very special child. Already a mother of two beautiful children, Dolores held in her arms a boy with fur like a dog and a hairline like Eddie Munster. She's here with us today with her real live, but sleeping, wolf baby.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: Hey, why not just give him a razor and some shaving cream? I mean, he’s going to be shaving in a couple of years anyway.

speaker: WOLF BOY MOTHER
line: Well, actually, he seems to be quite allergic to shaving cream. They seem to like him. They like to come up and touch his hair and tug on it a little.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: So they don't tease him?

speaker: WOLF BOY MOTHER
line: No. He's quite popular.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: Dandruff a problem?

speaker: WOLF BOY MOTHER
line: Mmm. No. I wash his hair twice a day and brush 100 strokes a night.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: I cain’t believe this.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: I think the question the audience really wants answered is, uh... what does the father look like?

speaker: WOLF BOY MOTHER
line: The father is completely bald.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: Completely bald?

speaker: WOLF BOY MOTHER
line: Completely.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: Were you a hairy kid?

speaker: WOLF BOY MOTHER
line: No. I was not.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: Seriously?

speaker: WOLF BOY MOTHER
line: Really.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: Come on. Fess up. We have pictures here. We happen to know that you had hair all over your face.

speaker: WOLF BOY MOTHER
line: I'm afraid that that cannot be true.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: I know this is a little delicate... but, uh, does he have any problem with fleas? I mean, he's not a real wolf boy, is he?

speaker: WOLF BOY MOTHER
line: No. I'm very careful about that. I buy the right products for fleas and... He does get the occasional itchies but he's all right.

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: You don’t have fleas?

speaker: CHER
line: LONLINESS….

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Hello?! IS THE CLOAK YOU WEAR …

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Who’s there? DEEP SHADE OF BLUE IS ALWAYS THERE THE SUN AIN’T GONNA SHINE ANYMORE THE MOON AINT GONNA RISE IN THE SKY THE TEARS ARE ALWAYS CLOUDING YOUR EYES WHEN YOU’RE WITHOUT LOVE ….

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Dear Special Agent Mulder: I’m writing to you for help. Several years ago I had an experience I could not explain. I was lying in my bed when I felt a presence in the room. Though I was awake. I felt that something had taken control over my body. I don’t remember much else but I woke up three days later pregnant with my son, Izzy. That was 18 years ago, but now it happened again. I was in bed and could swear I heard Cher singing … The one who was married to Sonny. Then the room got all smoky, and I saw some kind of monster. He had a really gross face with lumps all over his head. I was too scared to scream. Then I got all groggy and conked out for three days. Guess what happened when I woke up? I got your name off the TV. Some lady on the Jerry Springer show who had a werewolf baby said you came to her house. Well, I got her story beat by a mile so maybe you’ll want to come see me, too. Sincerely, Shaineh Berkowitz."

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, do you think it’s too soon to get my own 1-900 number?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: So, did you actually see that werewolf baby or was that just a story?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. It had something called hypertrechosis lanuginosa. It’s a rare hereditary condition most commonly found in some South American families.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Uh huh. But it was all hairy and stuff?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, Mrs. Berkowitz? You said that you also had a son?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Mm hmm. Izzy. That’s him there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And Izzy is the product of your union with some kind of intruder?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: I don’t know about no union, but I sure woke up in a condition.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you report this to the police?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Of course I did.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Was there an investigation?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Not really. Nobody here ever locks their doors, and it took me a month of two to figure it out … I mean, that I was pregnant.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And now you’re pregnant again?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Uh huh, but as I told Agent Mulder on the phone, that’s what takes the cake.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Berkowitz had a tubal ligation two years ago.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: You can’t plant a seed in a barren field. They were cooking something on the range. Took me two days of scrubbing to clean the skillet. I don’t know how many of them there were. I only saw the one, but they ate almost a whole damn jar of peanut butter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You were gone for three days, but nobody missed you?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: I know what you’re thinking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you drink, Mrs. Berkowitz?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: No. But I’m not so sure my intruders, as you call them, didn’t have a few. Somebody set a tumbler here and didn’t use no coaster.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mmm.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: That’s a family heirloom, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is there no chance that your son could have put it there?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Izzy’s got more brains than that. Not much more, but he values his life. That pigsty there is his room.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: You know what this thing is, don’t you Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Why do you say that?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: 'Cause you’re acting all quiet and stuff. And you know something you’re not saying -- about alien abductions. They said on the Jerry Springer show you’re, like, an expert.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I don’t think this has anything to do with alien abductions. I don’t even know if I believe in that stuff anymore.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Oh, come on. Really?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mrs. Berkowitz? You gave a description of the intruder. You said that he had a gross face and lumps on his head?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: And two mouths. I don’t know if I mentioned that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Funny. Sounds just like this.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Oh, that? That’s the Great Mutato. That’s a comic book character my kid Izzy created.

speaker: IZZY
line: What’s going on?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: These are agents Mulder and Scully from the FBI.

speaker: IZZY
line: The Federal Bureau of Investigation?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We were wondering how this suspect in your mother’s case looks exactly like this?

speaker: MULDER
line: The Great Mutato

speaker: IZZY
line: Because I … I’ve seen him, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’ve seen the Great Mutato?

speaker: IZZY
line: Yeah. A lot of people around here have.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Has it crossed neither of your minds that what you say you saw that night fits perfectly with this creature that your son created?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Well, yeah. But … that don’t mean it didn’t happen.

speaker: IZZY
line: Don’t ask me why, but it works.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Peanut butter sandwiches?

speaker: MULDER
line: You think baloney would be more effective?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why are you humoring them, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m not humoring them, Scully. This is a very serious crime.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So is perjury. So is calling out FBI agents under false pretenses.

speaker: MULDER
line: For the purpose of what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Isn’t it obvious? I think that what we’re seeing here is an example of the culture for whom daytime talk shows and tabloid headlines have - have become a reality against which they measure their lives – a culture so obsessed with the media and a chance for self-dramatization that they’ll do anything in order to gain a spotlight.

speaker: MULDER
line: I am alarmed that you would reduce these people to a cultural stereotype. Not everybody’s dream is to get on Jerry Springer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Psychologists often speak of the denial of an unthinkable evil or a misplacement of shared fears. Anxieties taking the form of a hideous monster for whom the most horrific human attributes can be ascribed. What we can’t possibly imagine ourselves capable of we can blame on the ogre, on the hunchback, on the lowly half-breed.

speaker: NOTE
line: Perfect opportunity for Cher's song, "Half-Breed", don'tcha think?!)

speaker: SCULLY
line: But common sense alone will tell you that these legends, these unverified rumors are ridiculous.

speaker: MULDER
line: But nonetheless, unverifiable, and therefore true in the sense that they’re believed to be true.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is there anything that you don’t believe in, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Shh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s that sound?

speaker: IZZY
line: It’s the Great Mutato.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where’d it go?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know. I lost it.

speaker: MULDER
line: There. Up there.

speaker: OLD MAN
line: Turn that damn thing off. You’re on my property.

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re with the FBI.

speaker: OLD MAN
line: They’re not.

speaker: IZZY
line: We were --

speaker: SCULLY
line: We were just chasing what they told us was a monster.

speaker: OLD MAN
line: Monster? What’d I tell you boys? There ain’t no monster. I’ll show you the monster you’re looking for.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Who sent you here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Your father.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: My father is a simpleton farmer. He understands nothing of my scientific achievements .

speaker: SCULLY
line: What achievements are those?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: What makes you think you’d understand them any better?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, I’m a scientist, for one.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Well, then you probably know that once in a generation, perhaps once in a lifetime, a truth is uncovered which thrusts mankind into a shocking new consciousness turning accepted notions of our very existence on their head. Consider relativity, the double helix, and now the Homeotic Hox gene, for which I will undoubtedly have my place among the Columbuses of science as a visionary leader of men.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Yes?

speaker: GEEK LAB BOY
line: What do you want me to do with these, Dr. Pollidori?

speaker: GEEK LAB BOY
line: Never mind.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is the Homeotic Hox gene?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: She’s the scientist. Ask her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I, uh … I believe it has something to do with, um … growth and development.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: If you two will excuse me, I really don’t have time for this. I have to travel tonight to the University of Ingolstadt to deliver an international address.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, unless you want your scientific achievements to end up as a footnote on the Jerry Springer Show, I suggest that you make the time.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Jerry Springer Show?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Witness the morphogenesis of Drosophila … the fruit fly. What you are watching has been going on for millennia since the Cambrian period some 580 million short years ago when Drosophila was first born. Notice the elegant symmetry with which the pupae grows into a series of beautiful segments. What we have found – what I have found – is that these segments represent a linear model for the genetic development of our friend, the fly. the legs, the mouth, the body, posterior and anterior. But which I, through my genius, can alter into a creation of my own. Behold … Proboscopedia.

speaker: MULDER
line: This fly has legs …

speaker: SCULLY
line: …. Growing out of his mouth.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why would you do that?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Because I can.

speaker: MULDER
line: Could that be done in humans?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: That would go against every scientific convention.

speaker: MULDER
line: But could it be done?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Theoretically.

speaker: MULDER
line: Good night, Dr. Frankenstein.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Despite what you might think, Mulder, designer mutations like these are virtually impossible in humans.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s not what I just heard.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, even if they could, no scientist would even dare to perform this kind of experiment on a human.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then why do them at all?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To unlock the mysteries of genetics, to understand how it is that even though we share the same genes we develop arms instead of wings. We become humans instead of flies or monsters.

speaker: MULDER
line: But, given the power, who could resist the temptation to create life in his own image?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We already have that ability, Mulder. It’s called "procreation." And first thing tomorrow morning, I’m going to verify the pregnancy of Shaineh Berkowitz.

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: When are you coming home again?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Huh?

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: When are you coming home again?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: What?

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: We were going to have that talk.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Soon, soon. We’ll have our talk soon.

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: That’s what you always say.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Elizabeth, you know how I feel about children. They’re mewling little monsters.

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: But I want children.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: What happened to our dream about getting out of this place - getting away from this hick town?

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: I think that’s your dream.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Listen, what do you want -- a baby or a Nobel Prize? See you on Thursday.

speaker: -AGENT ADMITS STORIES
line: "BELIEVED TO BE TRUE." SCULLY is not pleased.)

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Hot plates! Hot, hot, hot. Biscuits, fritters, grits, flapjacks, eggs boiled, scrambled, poached, and fried. We got some monster grapefruits on the way. Bigger than your head, almost.

speaker: MULDER
line: I -I’d just like some coffee, thanks.

speaker: WAITRESS
line: On the house. Compliments of J.J.

speaker: J.J.
line: That’s with two Js.

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Is it true that Jerry Springer’s coming to town?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’ve been had. I’ll save you the trouble of reading the article. It has everything we talked about last night word for word.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Izzy Berkowitz! Get your butt front and center!

speaker: IZZY
line: What did I do?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: All I can say is I hope the answer to that question is nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have reason to believe that you or one of your friends recorded our conversation last night and gave it to a newspaper reporter.

speaker: IZZY
line: Me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: In order to promote you comic book monster that you created.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you own a tape recorder, Izzy?

speaker: IZZY
line: Um …

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Christmas nineteen ninety THREE!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: … in the form of a hideous monster given the most horrific human attributes …

speaker: SHAINEH
line: That’s for starters!

speaker: SCULLY
line: … What we can’t possibly imagine…

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Hey! Hey that’s it. That’s the song that was playing when I got knocked up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who the hell is that?

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s the same voice we heard out in the woods last night.

speaker: IZZY
line: That’s him. The Great Mutato.

speaker: CHER AND GREAT MUTATO
line: THE SUN AIN'T GONNA SHINE ANYMORE THE MOON AIN'T GONNA RISE IN THE SKY TEARS ARE ALWAYS CLOUDING YOUR EYES THE SUN AIN'T GONNA SHINE ANYMORE WHEN YOU'RE WITHOUT... LOVE...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are we going now?

speaker: MULDER
line: To messenger this to the Bureau. I want special audio to filter the tracks and then I want to go back to see the professor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, this is just a dopey hoax.

speaker: MULDER
line: Something recorded its voice on this, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you think that Dr. Pollidori has something to do with it?

speaker: MULDER
line: When Victor Frankenstein asks himself "Whence did the principle of life proceed?" and then as a gratifying summit to his toils creates a hideous phantasm of a man he prefigures the Postmodern Prometheus. The genetic engineer whose power to reanimate matter – genes into life – us – is only as limited as his imagination is.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I’m alarmed that you would reduce this man to a literary stereotype, a mad scientist.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who else would go to such trouble to impregnate Shaineh Berkowitz?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have to admit, Mulder. Everything looks in order. Mrs. Berkowitz had a tubal ligation in 1993 and two months ago she had two pregnancy tests both with positive results.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Berkowitz said in her letter that when she saw her intruder there was a gaseous white cloud and then when she woke up three days later, nobody knew that she’d been gone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. So?

speaker: CHER
line: I WAS BORN IN THE WAGON OF A TRAVELIN' SHOW MY MAMA USED TO DANCE FOR THE MONEY THEY'D THROW PAPA WOULD DO WHATEVER HE COULD PREACH A LITTLE GOSPEL SELL A COUPLE BOTTLES OF DOCTOR GOOD GYPSIES, TRAMPS AND THIEVES WE'D HEAR IT FROM THE PEOPLE OF THE TOWN THEY CALLED US GYPSIES, TRAMPS AND THIEVES BUT EVERY NIGHT, ALL THE MEN WOULD COME AROUND AND LAY THEIR MONEY DOWN...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come on … Get up! Move!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: OLD MAN
line: I told you there ain’t no monster.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: What are you doing in my house?

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: He had this awful face with these hideous tumors, and … and not one mouth, but two.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Pollidori. Is there something you’d like to tell us?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Are you accusing me of knowing something that I’m not telling you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m accusing that your wife may have been impregnated.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Impregnated? By whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, I think you know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir, with all due respect I think that this is all part of a hoax.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: A hoax?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A shameless publicity stunt.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: What … what is that?

speaker: MULDER
line: The other victims, they had their frying pans … violated. Do you know what that is?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: No, I don’t.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think we found our smoking gun.

speaker: MASK BOY
line: Hey, Mom. You look great.

speaker: CHER
line: You look great.

speaker: MASK BOY
line: Mom, I have some great news.

speaker: CHER
line: Me, too.

speaker: MASK BOY
line: You first.

speaker: CHER
line: I quit. I’m clean as a whistle.

speaker: MASK BOY
line: All right, Ma …

speaker: OLD MAN
line: I brought you your favorite. You finish your movie but don’t stay up too late, okay, son?

speaker: MASK BOY
line: Well, that’s a start.

speaker: CHER
line: Well, what about your news?

speaker: MASK BOY
line: Oh, it’s no big deal. I met a girl. We’re going out.

speaker: CHER
line: Come on. Tell us.

speaker: MASK BOY
line: Well, her name is Diana ….

speaker: CHER
line: Yeah?

speaker: MASK BOY
line: And she’s beautiful. She’s got long blond hair. She rides horses and she’s beautiful and she’s smart and she loves me.

speaker: CHER
line: What’s not to love, baby?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Tell me it isn’t true. You didn’t. You wouldn’t. Why?

speaker: OLD MAN
line: Because I can.

speaker: LARGE MAN
line: Excuse me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not a problem.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s this?

speaker: WAITRESS
line: Compliments of J.J. Coffee?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sure.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whoa! That’s not a place you want to burn a guy. "FBI Agents Say Monster A ‘Hoax’.")

speaker: POSTAL MAN
line: You want to see your monster?

speaker: CROWD
line: Yeah!

speaker: POSTAL MAN
line: You really want to see your monster?

speaker: CROWD
line: Yeah!

speaker: POSTAL MAN
line: Here’s your monster.

speaker: POSTAL MAN
line: His name is Izzy Berkowitz!

speaker: CROWD
line: No! String him up!

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Get your filthy hands off him! You let him go!

speaker: POSTAL MAN
line: I intercepted a package.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: How would you like your face to intercept my fist, coconut head?

speaker: CROWD MAN
line: Your kid’s a monster!

speaker: CROWD
line: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Yeah!

speaker: SHAINEH
line: That is my son you’re talking about!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder …. You may have been right. That these people can be reduced to cultural stereotypes?

speaker: MULDER
line: They unmasked the monster.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I may have found something that says otherwise. The residue in the frying pan was an agricultural product used to anesthetize herds of animals.

speaker: MULDER
line: Used by who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Farmers … who have to register with the FDA even to have it in their possession.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there someone registered locally?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm - hmm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: We may be too late. I think we are. Who’s that? Show yourself!

speaker: SCULLY
line: If you’re armed, drop your weapon and walk out slowly!

speaker: CHICKENLIKE WOMAN
line: Please don’t … don’t kill me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: CHICKENLIKE WOMAN
line: I’m with the newspaper.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s your business here?

speaker: CHICKENLIKE WOMAN
line: The old man was murdered.

speaker: SCULLY
line: By whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s alive.

speaker: CHICKENLIKE WOMAN
line: I’ve seen it … in the barn, burying the old man

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever you have in mind, I’m going to have to ask you to stop right there.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: We have come for the murderer.

speaker: CROWD
line: Yeah!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What makes you think he’s here?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: I’ve seen him with my own eyes. He is not a man. He is a monster!

speaker: CROWD
line: Yeah!

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: The fiend must be found, and then we’ll let justice take its course!

speaker: CROWD
line: Yeah!

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: We’ll search every crevice, every ravine. You get him alive if you can, but you get him!

speaker: CROWD
line: Yeah! Kill him!

speaker: SCULLY
line: There’s only one way Pollidori could have seen that monster … If he was out here himself.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Federal agents, and we’re armed! Come on out!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully. Look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: MULDER
line: You’re going to have to come out of there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’re not going to hurt you. Do you think he understands?

speaker: MULDER
line: I hope not.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He looks frightened.

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re going to have to get him out of here, Scully. They’re going to kill him.

speaker: CROWD MAN
line: The barn’s on fire!

speaker: CROWD
line: Fire! Fire!

speaker: CHICKENLIKE REPORTER WOMAN
line: There it is!

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Let him go.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Where is he?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: You let him go or we’ll burn him out.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Where is he? Show the world your horrid, lumpy face!

speaker: CROWD
line: Yeah!

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: That’s him.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Ugh.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: That repulsive physiognomy is the vilest perversion of science.

speaker: MULDER
line: Created by whom?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: A pale student of my most hallowed arts whose life was taken by that which he gave life. By his own horrible creation. By that monstrosity that you see before you.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Who’s he taking about?

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: My father.

speaker: GREAT MUTATO
line: No.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: He can talk.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: Your ears deceive you. It’s a trick.

speaker: GREAT MUTATO
line: I’m sorry. My voice is damaged by the gaseous chemicals, but I would like to explain myself. Despite my appearance which you see is quite horrible to the human senses, I … have never acted to harm another soul.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: These are fiendish lies!

speaker: MULDER
line: Quiet.

speaker: GREAT MUTATO
line: 25 years ago, my father, having only one son, a spiteful, hateful man of science incapable of the deeper sentiments. He came to realize that this son had been conducting secret experiments of which I was the most unfortunate product.

speaker: GREAT MUTATO
line: A simple man, he rescued me and loved me in spite of my deformities. But, as time passed, I grew restless for friends of my own. Because I couldn’t go to school or play sports or… or even show my face outside this farm, my father set out to learn his son’s science so that before he died, he might create for me a mate.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: Uh oh.

speaker: GREAT MUTATO
line: Alas, my father was a simple man. His heart close to the soil he worked, the animals he tended….

speaker: GREAT MUTATO
line: The experiments he attempted too advanced for his understanding. The results of his experiments – unsatisfactory.

speaker: SHAINEH
line: I still … you mean, Izzy … but who’s the father?

speaker: GREAT MUTATO
line: Suffice to say his experiments failed and … my father is dead. I am alone … and miserable but one as deformed and horrible as myself would not deny herself to me. If this being you can create, then I will take blame as a murderer.

speaker: POLLIDORI
line: I don’t know how to re-create you. You were a mistake.

speaker: GREAT MUTATO
line: What we did was wrong, but in our trespasses we gave you a loving son and in your homes I went places I’d never dreamed of. With your books, and your records and home media centers, I learned of the world and of a mother’s love that I’ll never know. Cher loved that boy so much.

speaker: IZZY
line: Hey … he’s no monster.

speaker: GREAT MUTATO
line: Arrest me then, as you will.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We should go, Mulder. The prisoner’s in the car.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is all wrong, Scully. This is not how the story is supposed to end.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Frankenstein pays for his evil ambitions, yes. But the monster’s supposed to escape to go search for his bride.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There’s not going to be any bride, Mulder. Not in this story.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, where’s the writer? I want to speak to the writer.

speaker: CHER
line: PUT ON MY BLUE SUEDE SHOES AND I BOARDED THE PLANE TOUCHED DOWN IN THE LAND OF THE DELTA BLUES IN THE MIDDLE OF THE POURING RAIN W.C. HANDY WON'T YOU LOOK DOWN OVER ME? YEAH, I GOT A FIRST-CLASS TICKET BUT I’M AS BLUE AS A GIRL CAN BE WHEN I’M WALKING IN MEMPHIS I’M WALKING WITH MY FEET TEN FEET OFF OF BEALE

speaker: (VERY STYLIZED
line: MULDER looks at SCULLY, then forward. SCULLY looks at MULDER, then back at the GREAT MUTATO, then forward.) WALKING IN MEMPHIS BUT DO I REALLY FEEL THE WAY I FEEL?

speaker: JERRY SPRINGER
line: Tell me something, is it … is it hard to love these babies?

speaker: SHAINEH
line: What’s not to love?

speaker: CHER
line: WHEN I WAS WALKING IN MEMPHIS I WAS WALKING WITH MY FEET TEN FEET OFF OF BEALE WALKING IN MEMPHIS BUT DO I REALLY FEEL THE WAY I FEEL? PUT ON MY BLUE SUEDE SHOES...
